title: High-Performance Wordle Solver
long_description: A high-performance Wordle solving engine written in Python. It uses a clever data structure to find the best possible guess incredibly fast, achieving an average of 3.737 guesses when simulated 1,000 times starting with the word 'slate'.

The key to its speed is pre-indexing. Before any games are run, the entire word list is organized into a structure that works like a series of hash maps. There is one main map for each of the 5 letter positions.

When the solver gets a 'green' clue (right letter, right spot), it can instantly grab the exact list of all words that have that letter in that position. For example, it can find 'all words with S in position 0' in a single step. This positional indexing is what makes the filtering process almost instantaneous.

gallery.caption: The pre-computed data structure for instant filtering.
gallery.description: This diagram shows the core logic. The 'Position Map' (boxes 0-4) represents the five letter slots in a guess. Each position map points to a 'Letter Map' (A-F, etc.), which acts like a hash map. This structure lets the solver instantly find words based on clues. A 'green' clue like 'A in position 0' is a direct lookup. This pre-built index is the secret to its high-speed performance.
